name: Fish and chips
short_description: Crispy and golden, Wales' fish and chips showcase freshly fried white fish paired with fluffy, golden chips. A beloved British classic, it's the ultimate comfort food experience.

name: Cod fish and chips
short_description: Crispy, golden cod fillets, dipped in a light batter, pair perfectly with fluffy Maris Piper and King Edward chips. A beloved Welsh classic, it's a hearty taste of tradition with every bite.

name: Welsh Rarebit
short_description: Creamy, savory Welsh rarebit features rich, melted Cheddar or Caerphilly cheese blended with a hint of mustard and spices, served atop golden toast—a beloved snack steeped in Welsh heritage.

name: Faggots
short_description: Hearty and rustic, these traditional Welsh meatballs blend pork offal, bacon, and onions, delivering a rich, savory flavor. Perfectly paired with creamy mashed potatoes, they celebrate culinary heritage.

name: Welsh Cake
short_description: Griddle-baked to perfection, these traditional Welsh cakes blend flour, butter, and sugar with hints of spice and lemon zest. A beloved treat steeped in Welsh culture, they offer a delightful bite of history.

name: Cawl
short_description: A hearty Welsh stew, cawl combines tender lamb with earthy potatoes, fresh leeks, and vibrant cabbage and carrots. Traditionally simmered over an open fire, it warms both body and soul.

name: Cawl Cennin
short_description: Originating from Wales, this comforting leek and potato soup bursts with earthy flavors. Slowly simmered to perfection, it transforms humble ingredients into a hearty, soul-warming delight.

name: Bara Brith
short_description: Regarded as Wales' national fruitcake, this sweet bread delights with its rich blend of tea-soaked dried fruits, zesty orange, and a hint of honey, creating a moist, flavorful treat.

name: Welsh Onion Cake
short_description: Or teisien winwns, showcases layers of tender potatoes and sweet, caramelized onions, all baked to golden perfection. A beloved comfort food, it embodies the heart of Welsh culinary tradition.

name: Poten waed
short_description: Originating from Wales, this rich black pudding combines pig’s blood, hearty oats, and fragrant allspice, resulting in a savory delight that’s crispy on the outside and tender within. A true taste of tradition!

name: Anglesey Eggs
short_description: Hard-boiled eggs nestle in velvety mashed potatoes, enveloped in a rich leek, butter, and cheese sauce. A comforting Welsh classic, it's a delightful fusion of flavors and textures.

name: Glamorgan Sausages
short_description: Originating from Wales, these delightful vegetarian "sausages" combine rich Caerphilly cheese, savory leeks, and crispy breadcrumbs. Golden-fried to perfection, they offer a satisfying crunch and a burst of flavor in every bite.

name: Plaice fish and chips
short_description: Crispy, golden plaice fillets are expertly battered and fried, served alongside perfectly crispy Maris Piper, King Edward, and Desiree chips. A staple of Welsh cuisine, each bite is a savory delight.

name: Miser's Feast
short_description: Originating from Wales, this hearty casserole layers tender potatoes, savory pork, and smoky bacon, creating a comforting dish that embodies frugality and rustic charm. Perfect for sharing!

name: Roast Lamb with Laver Sauce
short_description: Tender roast lamb, a Welsh classic, is perfectly paired with rich laver sauce made from seaweed. The savory flavors and unique pairing make it a must-try for an authentic taste of Wales.

name: Pollock fish and chips
short_description: Crisp, golden-battered Pollock pairs perfectly with fluffy Maris Piper and King Edward potatoes in this classic Welsh favorite. Enjoy the satisfying crunch and savory flavors of this beloved seaside treat.

name: Tatws pum munud
short_description: A cherished Welsh dish, this hearty stew layers tender potatoes with crispy bacon, sweet carrots, and aromatic onions, all simmered in rich stock for a comforting, rustic flavor.

name: Skate fish and chips
short_description: Fresh skate fillets are lovingly battered and fried to golden perfection, paired with crispy Maris Piper and King Edward chips. A beloved Welsh staple, it’s a hearty taste of coastal tradition.

name: Crempog
short_description: Welsh crempog delights with its fluffy texture and tangy buttermilk flavor. Cooked on a hot stone, these pancakes are perfect for breakfast or a sweet treat, often enjoyed with syrup or fruit.

name: Katt Pie
short_description: Originating from Wales, this hearty savory pie features a flaky pastry filled with tender ground lamb or mutton, fragrant thyme, and a hint of zesty lemon, creating a delightful flavor harmony.

name: Aberffraw Biscuit
short_description: Originating from Wales, these traditional shortbread cookies are crafted from high-quality butter, flour, and sugar, delivering a rich, melt-in-your-mouth experience that celebrates Britain's oldest biscuit.

name: Tatws popty
short_description: Oven-roasted to perfection, Tatws popty combines tender potatoes with savory meat, creating a hearty Welsh classic. Each bite delivers comforting flavors steeped in tradition and warmth.

name: Punchnep
short_description: Originating from Wales, this comforting root vegetable mash blends earthy flavors of swede and carrots with rich butter or cream, creating a creamy, savory delight perfect for any meal.

name: Aberaeron Broth
short_description: Originating from Wales, this hearty broth blends smoky bacon, tender beef, and vibrant vegetables like cabbage and leeks. Slow-cooked to perfection, it warms the soul with every spoonful.
